actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4785.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Ms. Jacobs (CA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4785 — "To support the human rights of Uyghurs and members of other minority groups residing in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region and safeguard their distinct identity, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 744.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Ms. Jacobs (CA) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended. H. Res. 744 — "Condemning the Government of Iran's state-sponsored persecution of its Baha'i minority and its continued violation of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 922.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Ms. Jacobs (CA) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended. H. Res. 922 — "Condemning the use of hunger as a weapon of war and recognizing the effect of conflict on global food security and famine."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5455.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Nadler moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5455 — "To amend the First Step Act of 2018 to permit defendants convicted of certain offenses to be eligible for reduced sentences, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3115.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Nadler moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3115 — "To remove the 4-year sunset from the Pro bono Work to Empower and Represent Act of 2018."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3846.
Mr. Nadler moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. S. 3846 — "To reauthorize the Justice and Mental Health Collaboration Program, and for other purposes."
Considered under suspension of the rules.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 4003.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Nadler moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 4003 — "To amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to provide for training on alternatives to use of force, de-escalation, and mental and behavioral health and suicidal crises."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 231.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Ms. Stevens moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 231 — "To direct the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency to develop guidance for firefighters and other emergency response personnel on best practices to protect them from exposure to PFAS and to limit and prevent the release of PFAS into the environment, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7158.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Takano moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7158 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to enter into contracts and agreements for the payment of care in non-Department of Veterans Affairs medical foster homes for certain veterans who are unable to live independently, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5943.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Takano moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5943 — "To designate the outpatient clinic of the Department of Veterans Affairs in Greenville, South Carolina, as the "Lance Corporal Dana Cornell Darnell Outpatient Clinic"."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4772.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Takano moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4772 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve the application and review process of the Department of Veterans Affairs for clothing allowance claims submitted by veterans, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4601.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Takano moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4601 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to award grants to States to improve outreach to veterans, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2521.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Takano moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2521 — "To require the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to establish a pilot program to furnish doula services to veterans."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House resumed with one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Res. 1494 — "Permitting official photographs of the House of Representatives to be taken while the House is in actual session on a date designated by the Speaker."
Mr. Aguilar asked unanimous consent to consider as introduced.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: ADJUSTED WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under clause 5(d) of rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the death of the gentleman from Virginia, Mr. McEachin, the whole number of the House is 432.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal. Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
